channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pot holes on side of road of army barracks, 1st March
item.description:
Pot hole done Frog Furlong Lane on the army barracks side all along the lane - several of them
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Frog Furlong Lane, Innsworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The valentines heart-shaped pothole is back again., 28th February
item.description:
The valentines heart-shaped pothole is back again. Same as before. On the left, between Wisteria and Coriander, going north, towards the Highgrove roundabout and NATO. Could it be surveyed and repaired ASAP please ? Thankyou !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 361, Innsworth Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Holes everywhere, 28th February
item.description:
The section of road just past Post Office Lane is now dangerous. Continuously reported and nothing is done. A total nightmare to drive on. Why can’t you sort this out? It’s been years!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stockwell Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Between 11 Moorend Park and the bungalow there are two sleeping policemen. Much of the tarmac has been stripped leaving potholes, 28th February
item.description:
On the road between 11 Moorend Road and the bungalow. I have video pictures but cannot upload them.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Moorend Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Huge pothole on way out of Cowley village. Anyone with bicycle or motorcycle is at high risk, cars risk tyre blow out or wreck suspension, 28th February
item.description:
Just after the bridge on way out of Cowley village
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cowley, Cotswold

item.title: Dear Sir/Madam I live at 24D Moorend Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham, GL53 0HD and have off road parking. The problem I have is that from the road onto to my drive way is now extremely uneven and results in the vehicles scraping the underside front and back. Can I ask if the highways Dept, or whoever is responsible for this, to come and take a look and also make repairs so that it is more even and I can park the cars onto my drive way without causing damage. It's more of a levelling requirement - From Road to pavement to my drive way., 28th February
item.description:
Moorend Road onto the Curb onto my driveway at number 24D Moorend Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24d, Moorend Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface
